election_record.label: Ohio 1820 Governor

overview.note: The Official Certified Vote lists Ethan A. Brown with 34836 votes, Jeremiah Morrow with 9426 votes, William H. Harrison with 4348 votes, and "others" with 243 votes.
The Ohio Repository (Canton, OH) lists Ethan A. Brown with 37020 votes, Jeremiah Morrow with 10071 votes, William H. Harrison with 4512 votes, and a scattering of 279 votes. December 28, 1820.

The Western Reserve Chronicle (Warren, OH) lists Ethan A. Brown with 34836 votes, Jeremiah Morrow with 9426 votes, William H. Harrison with 4348 votes, and a scattering of 279 votes. December 28, 1820.
The Republican Advocate (Huntington) lists Ethan A. Brown with 34936 votes, Jeremiah Morrow with 9426 votes, and William H. Harrison with 4336 votes. January 11, 1821.

sub_unit.name: Columbiana
sub_unit.note: The Official Certified Vote lists Jeremiah Morrow with 0 votes.

sub_unit.name: Coshocton
sub_unit.note: The votes from Coshocton County were not included in the Official Certified Vote.

sub_unit.name: Fayette
sub_unit.note: The votes from Fayette County were not included in the Official Certified Vote.

sub_unit.name: Knox
sub_unit.note: The Official Certified Vote lists William Henry Harrison with 2 votes.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: The Official Certified Vote lists William H. Harrison with 0 votes. Ohio House Journal for 1820. 76-77.

sub_unit.name: Pike
sub_unit.note: The votes from Pike County were not included in the Official Certified Vote.

sub_unit.name: Preble
sub_unit.note: The votes from Preble County were not included in the Official Certified Vote.

sub_unit.name: Ross
sub_unit.note: The Official Certified Vote lists the two votes for William H. Harrison as being for "others." Ohio House Journal for 1820. 76-77.
The Supporter (Chillicothe, OH) lists Ethan A. Brown with 238 votes, Jeremiah Morrow with 1845 votes, and William H. Harrison with 2 votes.

sub_unit.name: Sandusky
sub_unit.note: The candidate for Governor was not listed in the Abstract of Votes. It is most likely Ethan A. Brown.
The votes from Sandusky County were not included in the Official Certified Vote.

sub_unit.name: Scioto
sub_unit.note: The votes from Scioto County were not included in the Official Certified Vote.

sub_unit.name: Trumbull
sub_unit.note: Cleaveland Herald (Cleveland, OH) lists 57 votes for William H. Harrison.

sub_unit.name: Warren
sub_unit.note: "It was generally believed by the electors of this county that this gentleman [Jeremiah Morrow] was not a candidate." The Western Star (Lebanon, OH). October 14, 1820.
